summary:
Mongooses are small meat-eating mammals found in southern Europe, Africa, and Asia. They belong to two groups: Herpestinae (23 species) and Mungotinae (11 species). These groups split from a common ancestor around 20 million years ago.

Mongooses are known for their quick movements and ability to hunt snakes and other small animals. They have a long history of evolution, with the oldest known mongoose fossil dating back to the Early Miocene era.
title: Mongoose
